First, as the efficacy of UVGI is dependent on the absorption by the target DNA, which has a maximum absorption wavelength of 260 nm, microorganisms have been found to be selectively vulnerable to the exposure to light at wavelengths specifically at or in close range of 253.7 nm.
158 When tested against the strain of bacteriophage virus ΦX‐174, it was shown that the wavelength could be increased to up to 280nm without significant reduction of virucidal efficiency, but a significant decrease was observed upon the increase to 301 nm.
